meanings.definition: A person who prohibits or prevents something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The forbidders at the meeting made sure no one brought outside food.
meanings.sent2: The forbidders in the neighborhood banned loud music after 10 pm.
meanings.sent3: The forbidders at the party were like the fun police, stopping all the games.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules turned her into the forbidders of the household, always saying no.
meanings.sent5: The forbidders of the group always ruined our plans with their restrictions.

meanings.definition: Those who give orders or commands against something.
meanings.sent1: The forbidders in the army issued orders to retreat from the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The forbidders in the school declared a ban on using cell phones during class.
meanings.sent3: The forbidders at the picnic were like the anti-fun committee, stopping all the games.
meanings.sent4: His strict instructions turned him into the forbidders of the project, always saying no to new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The forbidders of the team always stifled creativity with their strict regulations.
